text: The 1971–1972 Algerian Championnat National was the 10th season of the Algerian Championnat National since its establishment in 1962. A total of 16 teams contested the league, with MC Oran as the defending champions, The Championnat started on September 5, 1971 and ended on June 18, 1972. ==Team summaries== === Promotion and relegation === Teams promoted from Algerian Division 2 1971–1972 * USM Blida * GC Mascara * JS Djijel Teams relegated to Algerian Division 2 1972–1973 * WA Tlemcen * USM Alger * ES Guelma ==League table== ==Season statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Scorer !Club !Goals |- !|1 |align="left"| Rabah Gamouh |align="left"|MO Constantine | style="text-align:center;"|24 |- !|2 |align="left"| Hassen Tahir |align="left"|MC Alger | style="text- align:center;"|20 |- !|3 |align="left"| Boualem Amirouche |align="left"|NAR Alger | style="text-align:center;"|17 |- !|4 |align="left"| Aït Hamouda |align="left"|NAR Alger | style="text-align:center;"|14 |- !|5 |align="left"| Mourad Derridj |align="left"|JS Kawkabi | style="text-align:center;"|13 |- !|6 |align="left"| Benyekhlef |align="left"|WA Tlemcen | style="text- align:center;"|13 |- !|7 |align="left"| Sid Ahmed Belkedrouci |align="left"|MC Oran | style="text-align:center;"|12 |- !|8 |align="left"| Benmokhtar |align="left"|ASM Oran | style="text-align:center;"|11 |- |} ==References== ==External links== *1971–72 Algerian Championnat National Category:Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1 seasons Category:1971–72 in Algerian football Algeria
title: 1971–72 Algerian Championnat National
